lang.name: en_CA
lang.key: Maintained by Madison Kelly (mkelly@alteeve.ca) for the ScanCore.

Connecting to Database with configuration ID: [#!variable!id!#] - driver: [#!variable!driver!#] - host: [#!variable!host!#] - port: [#!variable!port!#] - postgres_password: [#!variable!postgres_password!#] - name: [#!variable!name!#] - user: [#!variable!user!#] - password: [#!variable!password!#] - initialize: [#!variable!initialize!#]
Connected to database: [#!variable!name!#] (id: [#!variable!id!#]) on host: [#!variable!host!#:#!variable!port!#]. The file handle is: [#!variable!conf_dbh!# (#!variable!dbh!#)].
The database: [#!variable!name!#] on: [#!variable!host!#] needs to be initialized.
Failed to connect to database: [#!variable!name!#] on host: [#!variable!host!#:#!variable!port!#].
Is the server running and does the firewall allow connections on TCP port: [#!variable!port!#]?
The password was not passed, and it is required. Please set: [scancore::db::#!variable!id!#::password = <password>] in: [#!variable!config_file!#].
The password set for the user: [#!variable!user!#] is incorrect. Please update: [scancore::db::#!variable!id!#::password = <password>] in: [#!variable!config_file!#].
This database can not be used, skipping it.
Error during DB 'do'. The error was: ---------- #!variable!dbi_error!# ----------
There were errors writing data to the database. Rolling back!
Failed to prepare the database query: [#!variable!query!#] on: [#!variable!server!#]. The error was: [#!variable!db_error!#].
Failed to execute the database query: [#!variable!query!#] on: [#!variable!server!#]. The error was: [#!variable!db_error!#].
Failed to read the file: [#!variable!shell_call!#]. The error was: [#!variable!error!#].
Failed to connect to any database, unable to proceed.
Not ID passed to the database initializing method.
